description._content: Pro-Director 1976-1979 'Alan Stuart came to the school as a student for the BSc Econ degree in 1946 after war service. He specialised in statistics and graduated in 1949 with First Class Honours, being awarded the Farr Medal as the best statistics graduate of his year. He stayed on as research assistant to Maurice Kendall who had just been appointed as the School's second Professor of Statistics. After promotion to Research Officer and Senior research Officer he joined the teaching staff as Reader in Statistics in 1958, was appointed to a professorship in 1966 and continued in this post until opting for early retirement this year...Alan served as Pro-Director of the school from 1976-1979...' LSE Magazine, November 1983, No66, p.21 (Retirements) IMAGELIBRARY/263 Persistent URL: archives.lse.ac.uk/dserve.exe?dsqServer=lib-4.lse.ac.uk&a...
